page.title: 05Pubs in Malmesbury
page.content: In the nineteenth century, Malmesbury had thirty two pubs, but today only nine survive. One of the pubs which has disappeared was called {'The Brewery Tap'}in the Cross Hayes; it is now a video shop. Another was {'The White Lion'}near the Market Cross, now a private house. Once a maid there was{savaged by a tiger}from a travelling circus. Another popular pub was{'The Flying Monk',}knocked down to make way for a{supermarket. Many of the present pubs are of historic interest.{'The Rose and {Crown'}used to be part of Malmesbury's medieval wall.{"The King's Arms", Malmesbury's{oldest pub,}used to be a coaching inn.{"The Old Bell"}used to be a part of Malmesbury Abbey. We carried out a survey using the pubs. The thing they enjoyed most was the friendly atmosphere in pubs.
